description: North Korea fired a suspected intercontinental ballistic missile toward waters off its east coast, further raising tensions in the region after the US warned that its dispatch of troops to Russia could widen the war in Ukraine.
title: North Korea Fires Suspected ICBM as Tensions Grow Over Troops

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom ordered state agencies to look for ways to lower electricity rates that have become some of the nation’s highest, so long as any proposed cuts don’t threaten the fight against climate change.
title: California Governor Gavin Newsom Takes Aim at High Electricity Rates

description: Days after taking charge of Southeast Asia’s biggest economy, Indonesia’s president needs a plan to deal with rising borrowing costs for key state-owned enterprises carrying $186 billion of debt.
title: Indonesia’s New President Faces $186 Billion Debt Dilemma

description: Argentine President Javier Milei fired Foreign Minister Diana Mondino Wednesday after she voted at the United Nations in favor of ending the US embargo against Cuba.
title: Milei Fires Foreign Minister After UN Vote on Cuba Embargo

description: Donald Trump says “tariff” is his favorite word, campaigning on a bet that steep import levies will force manufacturers to move factories to the US.
title: Trump Threat to Biden’s Industrial Policy Hangs Over Asian Firms

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves promised that Labour’s first budget in more than a decade would end austerity and break the grip of economic stagnation. The plan she delivered will take so long to bear fruit the party will need to win another election to claim its reward.
title: Reeves Resurrects Big State in Labour’s Bid to ‘Rebuild’ Britain

description: On this week’s episode of Voternomics, we discuss the struggle by executives to avoid appearing political in hyper-partisan times.
title: Why Endorsing Candidates Has Become ‘Terrible’ for Business

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, real economy reporter Mark Niquette dissects the final batch of economic data to be released before the election.
title: News on the Economy Hasn’t Shifted Deadlocked Trump-Harris Race

description: For the full experience visit: Reeves Spent Billions But Still Ended Up With Sluggish UK Growth
title: Reeves Spent Billions But Still Ended Up With Sluggish UK Growth

description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni addressed a national scandal over the illegal sale of confidential personal data, saying some civil servants acted disloyally in a case that saw data on political and business leaders hacked from national security databases.
title: Italy’s Meloni Says Civil Servants Were Disloyal in Hacking Case

description: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said North Korea’s dispatch of troops to Russia risks widening the Ukraine conflict, as allies seek to discourage Moscow and Pyongyang from deploying the soldiers in battle.
title: US Warns North Korean Troops May Widen Russia’s War on Ukraine

description: The UK’s wealthy are relieved that the new Labour government did not hit them as hard as expected in its first budget, but were less reassured about tax raises that could yet come.
title: UK’s Wealthy Relieved Labour Tax Hikes Are Not as Bad as Feared, For Now

description: A potential new whaling license for Iceland’s only hunting company is stirring controversy in the north Atlantic nation just a month ahead of the parliamentary elections.
title: Whaling License Controversy Surfaces Ahead of Icelandic Election

description: The European Union has decided to send officials to Beijing to hold more talks aimed at finding an alternative to tariffs on electric vehicles from China, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Set to Send Envoys to China to Explore EV Tariff Alternative

description: As UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves wound up her key budget speech, bond traders seemed content.
title: UK Bond Vigilantes Send Reeves a Reminder That They’re Watching

description: On this episode of In the City, we discuss what Rachel Reeves’ first budget means for citizens, businesses and the government.
title: Labour’s Big New Budget May Be a Big Gamble

description: The leader of Lithuania’s Social Democratic Party has unexpectedly refused to take up the premiership of the Baltic nation despite her party’s election victory on Sunday.
title: Leader of Lithuania’s Winning Party Refuses to Be Prime Minister

description: Relations between Venezuela and Brazil are deteriorating quickly after Nicolas Maduro’s hopes of joining the BRICS bloc of emerging market countries were dashed by his neighbor.
title: Venezuela Ratchets Up Rhetoric Against Brazil Over BRICS Veto

description: The campaign of former president Donald Trump sued the board of elections in a suburban county just north of Philadelphia for allegedly turning away voters who sought mail-in ballots.
title: Trump Campaign Sues in Philadelphia Suburb Over Mail-In Ballots

description: Tax-driven revenue increases will ease Ontario’s budget deficit, the province said in an economic update, giving the government room to spend ahead of a potential election next spring.
title: Stronger Economy Boosts Ontario Revenue Ahead of Possible Election

description: Rachel Reeves’ UK budget on Wednesday was historic for being the first delivered by a woman. But it was also notable for being among the biggest tax-raising events in recent decades, a move the chancellor said was necessary to fix the foundations of the British economy.
title: Here Are the Key UK Budget Measures Announced by Rachel Reeves

description: Ghana’s top court has ordered the Speaker of Parliament to reverse a decision that left four seats vacant, a ruling which will restore President Nana Akufo-Addo’s majority in the 275-member house if implemented before new elections in December.
title: Ghana Top Court Orders Reinstatement of Ruling Party’s Majority

description: The UK government’s plans to expand access to childcare risks unraveling over higher taxes for employers, industry leaders said, as they warned that costs may be passed onto parents or providers could be forced to close.
title: UK Nurseries at Risk of Closing Under New Budget, Industry Warns

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken called on Congress to help fix a “broken” system that forces damaging budget cuts and leaves key roles vacant for long stretches.
title: Blinken Says ‘Broken’ System Undermines US Position in World

description: Wisconsin Democratic Senator Tammy Baldwin pitched her support for tax cuts for the middle class instead of the wealthy and corporations as a defining difference in her key reelection fight against a Republican banker.
title: Democrat Tammy Baldwin Pitches Middle Class Tax Cuts in Key Senate Race

description: Despite widespread skepticism about how much trust investors should place in the signals being sent by cryptocurrency-based predictions market Polymarket, Wall Street is paying close attention to betting on the platform that shows a high chance Donald Trump will win the US presidential election.
title: Polymarket’s Influence on Wall Street’s Election ‘Game Plan’ Grows Despite Red Flags

description: The European Central Bank is confronting new economic realities and governments should do the same, said Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.
title: Villeroy Says Governments — Not the ECB — Are Defining Europe’s Future

description: Russia’s plan to send two strategic bombers to Pretoria as a display of defense cooperation was postponed after the plan was criticized by one of the main members of South Africa’s coalition government.
title: Russian Strategic-Bomber Visit to South Africa Is Postponed

description: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson is proposing a $300 million property tax hike — breaking a campaign promise — to help close next year’s nearly $1 billion budget shortfall.
title: Chicago Mayor Proposes Property Tax Hike, Breaking Campaign Vow

description: Canada would have to nearly double its defense spending to keep its promise of reaching the NATO target of 2% of gross domestic product by 2032, the country’s budget watchdog says.
title: Canada Must Double Defense Spending to Meet NATO Target, Watchdog Says

description: Canada is bracing for Indian government-backed hacking as the two nations’ diplomatic relationship nosedives to its lowest ebb in a generation.
title: Canada Predicts Hacking From India as Diplomatic Feud Escalates

description: US federal government spending on national defense surged in the third quarter at the fastest pace in more than two decades, helping propel gross domestic product higher ahead of the November election.
title: US Defense Spending Boosts GDP With Biggest Surge Since Iraq War

description: Egypt’s program to offer stakes in state-held companies in various sectors will be reviewed in light of the current “extraordinary” circumstances the nation is facing, Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouly said Wednesday.
title: Egypt State Asset Sale Program to be Reviewed, Prime Minister Says

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy expressed annoyance that details of requests he made to the White House for more US long-range missiles were leaked to the media.
title: Zelenskiy Laments White House Leak on Tomahawk Missile Request

description: When he was president, Donald Trump sought to ban people from seven predominantly Muslim nations from entering the US. More recently, he has stood shoulder to shoulder with Israel’s prime minister and used the word Palestinian as an insult.
title: Trump’s Momentum With Muslims Threatens Harris’ Lead in Michigan

description: Vice President Kamala Harris said she “strongly” disagreed with comments made by President Joe Biden that have been seized on by Republicans as insulting to Donald Trump’s supporters, seeking to distance herself from a brewing controversy that threatens to undercut her momentum in the final week of campaigning.
title: Harris ‘Strongly’ Denounces Criticism of Voters After Biden Flap

description: Brazil’s Finance Minister Fernando Haddad has won over one of the government’s biggest critics of spending cuts, moving closer to approving an austerity plan designed to assuage investor concerns about the country’s fiscal outlook.
title: Brazil’s Government Moves Closer to Agreeing on Spending Cuts

description: The US is sanctioning almost 400 individuals and companies in India, China and Turkey as part of a bid to crack down on a sprawling network that has helped keep Russia’s war machine running nearly three years into the full-scale invasion of Ukraine.
title: US Sanctions Hundreds of Targets Supplying Russia’s War Machine

description: China and India have pulled back troops from the remaining two friction points on the disputed Himalayan border, ending a four-year stalemate that soured relations between the neighbors.
title: China, India Withdraw Troops From Leftover Border Friction Areas

description: The US Supreme Court let Virginia carry out a purge of an estimated 1,600 residents from its voter rolls, dividing along ideological lines in an early test of the role the justices may play in next week’s presidential election.
title: Supreme Court Lets Virginia Purge Voter Rolls for Election

description: Q&A: What the 2024 US election means for your money
title: Q&A: Trump’s Proposed Tariffs Risk a New Trade War

description: The UK will end a system that offered tax breaks to the country’s wealthiest foreigners in a move that Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said would raise £12.7 billion ($16.5 billion) over the next five years.
title: UK to End Preferential Tax Regime for Ultra-Rich Foreigners

description: Egypt’s talks with the International Monetary Fund are aimed at extending the implementation of measures called for under the country’s $8 billion loan program, not to secure more funds, Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouly said Wednesday.
title: Egypt’s Talks With IMF Aim to Prolong Loan Measures, PM Says

description: AstraZeneca Plc’s China President Leon Wang is under investigation by Chinese authorities, the drugmaker said Wednesday.
title: AstraZeneca’s China President Under Investigation by Authorities

description: Rumors and conspiracy theories interfered with recovery efforts in North Carolina. It wasn’t a one-off, experts say.
title: Misinformation Is Turning American Disasters Into Toxic Battlegrounds

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said she would raise UK taxes by £40 billion ($51.8 billion) in her historic first budget, to boost spending on public services and to cover a fiscal hole she said was left by the previous Conservative government.
title: Reeves Lifts UK Taxes by £40 Billion in First Labour Budget

description: The Swiss National Bank is prepared to intervene in currency markets if the outcome of the US presidential election leads to an appreciation of the franc, its president said.
title: SNB Ready to Fight Franc Jump From Trump Election, Schlegel Says

description: South Africa plans to establish infrastructure investment trusts and set up a blended-finance vehicle to lure investment to build roads, power-transmission networks and other public-works projects.
title: S. Africa Plans Infrastructure Investment Trusts to Lure Funding

description: South Africa’s government is still considering whether to adopt a new fiscal anchor that will provide a sustainable long-term path for public finances, despite opposition from within the country’s biggest political party.
title: S. Africa Treasury Weighs Options to Cap Debt Despite Opposition

description: South Africa’s medium-term budget – the first since the formation of a new coalition government in June – focused on luring investors for infrastructure projects, but an increase in spending and lower-than-anticipated revenue meant the budget deficit exceeded forecasts.
title: Winners and Losers in South Africa’s First Coalition Budget

description: Below are the highlights of South Africa’s 2024 medium-term budget policy statement released by Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana in Cape Town on Wednesday.
title: Highlights of South African Finance Minister’s Budget Update

description: South Africa’s budget update showed public finances are under increasing pressure, heightening the need for the new coalition government to lure more investment to the region’s biggest economy.
title: South Africa Courts Investment as Debt Trajectory Worsens

description: South Africa’s government is reinstating a plan to offer early retirement to senior civil servants as it seeks to reduce its wage bill.
title: S. Africa Offers State Workers Early Retirement to Cut Wage Bill

description: Republicans lost three recent lawsuits challenging how battleground states are handling voting for US citizens living overseas, with one Michigan judge slamming the “11th-hour attempt to disenfranchise” Americans ahead of the Nov. 5 election.
title: Swing State Judges Rebuff GOP Challenges to 2024 Overseas Voting

description: The European Union should work with member states’ spy agencies to create a bloc-level platform for cooperation, according to a recommendation that dialed back initial plans for an EU intelligence service.
title: EU Must Boost Intelligence Ties to Counter Threats, Report Says

description: More than 50 people died as eastern Spain was hit by one of the worst storms in decades on Tuesday night.
title: Spain Reports 50 Dead After One of the Worst Storms in a Century

description: During Marcelo’s first week in Santiago I prison, he was glad when his fellow inmates handed him a phone so he could call his girlfriend and family.
title: Killings and Prison Torture Raise Alarms Over Gang Crime in Chile

description: The next US president needs to push through a truce that would get Russia and Ukraine on board to end the war, according to Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic, who maintains channels to both warring parties.
title: New US President Needs to Forge Ukraine Truce, Serb Leader Says

description: Georgia’s Prosecution Service opened a probe into fraud allegations in the country’s parliamentary elections and said it plans to question President Salome Zourabichvili about her claims that the results were rigged.
title: Georgia Summons President for Questions in Election-Fraud Probe

description: Two financial pros, on opposite sides this Election Day, have tailored their stock picks to politics. It wasn’t as popular with investors as they planned.
title: In Red/Blue America, Hard Lessons About the Color of Money

description: Faced by a shortage of foreign reserves, Argentina’s central bank is turning to an unusual source of funding for this time of year: a risky trade by crop exporters.
title: Milei Taps Unseasonal Source in Search of Dollars in Argentina

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The US Drive to Stem China’s Tech Rise Is Stalling

description: Israel is considering a deal to end the conflict with Hezbollah in Lebanon that would see the militant group’s fighters move away from the Israeli border, after assessing its rocket arsenal has been mostly expended or destroyed.
title: Israel Eyes Deal to End Lebanon Combat After Weakening Hezbollah

description: Clear Ballot’s new voting machines show just how slow and steady the industry’s incorporation of digital tech has been.
title: Big, Clunky, Paper-Driven—and Tough to Hack

description: Thailand will stick to an inflation target of 1% to 3% for next year, a win for the central bank that has resisted the government’s demands to set a higher band to make room for price gains and spur further rate cuts.
title: Thailand to Retain Inflation Target in Victory for Central Bank

description: As Trump’s shadow looms over Europe, Berlin should try a dose of self-help that Paris can’t.
title: Germany Can Find Exit Ramp Off Road to Nowhere

description: Botswana governing party is poised to extend its almost six-decade rule of the diamond-rich southern African nation in Wednesday’s elections, securing a second five-year term for President Mokgweetsi Masisi.
title: Diamond-Rich Botswana Set to Extend Ruling Party’s 58-Year Reign

description: European leaders are growing concerned as a series of votes on the region’s eastern periphery test a decades-long march toward Western integration and Vladimir Putin’s longstanding attempt to halt it.
title: Kremlin Is Advancing in Hybrid War on Europe’s Eastern Flank

description: Saudi Arabia sees recent trends in foreign direct investment moving in the right direction, while conceding the kingdom has a long way to go to meet its 2030 goal of attracting $100 billion a year.
title: Saudi Arabia Upbeat on FDI as 2030 Goal Remains Distant

description: Malaysia’s High Court ordered former premier Najib Razak to defend himself against corruption and money laundering charges related to the sovereign wealth fund 1MDB, in a fresh blow to the politician who’s already in jail over the scandal.
title: Malaysia Court Orders Najib to Defend More 1MDB Charges
